alert.note: Alert for Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 7:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of West Feliciana, western West Baton Rouge, Pointe Coupee, northwestern Iberville Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and central Wilkinson Counties through 745 PM CST... At 659 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Dolorosa to near Cecilia. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Roads, St. Francisville, Livonia, Maringouin, Woodville, Fordoche, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Morganza, Wakefield, Batchelor, Erwinville, Lettsworth, Ramah, Fort Adams, Dolorosa and Lottie. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 130 and 143. TIME...MOT...LOC 0059Z 207DEG 122KT 3125 9144 3039 9185 MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Iberville; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge
